pr_title: Verify tenant from command target address

timeline.bodyText:
What about a downstream application sending a command on a command/TenantA link and using command/TenantB/someDevice in the command message to address?
Can we be sure that the AMQP messaging network rejects such a message if the sender has only been given rights to send on the command/TenantA address? I'm not sure if the qdrouter for example checks the to address here as well.
timeline.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText:
Good point. This, however, means that we would not be able to receive all commands for all tenants using a link source address of tenant/#.
BTW the current implementation also does not check if the tenant ID from the command target address matches the tenant from the link source address used to receive the command. Instead, we simply use the tenant from the link source address with the device ID from the command target address. This effectively prevents applications from sending a command to a device of another tenant but does not detect programming errors if a device with the same ID exists in multiple tenants ...
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
This, however, means that we would not be able to receive all commands for all tenants using a link source address of tenant/#.

(You mean command/#, I guess.)
I've done a test here and the Qdrouter seems to allow sending messages with a to address, to which the sender hasn't been given rights for, as long as there are rights for the link address. (I guess the more expensive to address auth check in the Qdrouter for every received message is only done in case of a sender on the anonymous link address.)
So that is something that speaks against using the command/# receiver link instead of the tenant based links.
Therefore I would suggest keeping the tenant parameter here. The missing comparison with the tenant from the to address is indeed missing and should be added.
replies.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText:
@calohmn I have added the check for the tenant from the command message.
Would you mind taking another look?
replies.author: sophokles73

timeline.message:
Verify tenant from command target address

When mapping and delegating a command message, the tenant from the
message's address is now being compared to the tenant that the command
receiver link is scoped to.

Signed-off-by: Kai Hudalla <kai.hudalla@bosch.io>
